header.name: chaos/preprocessor/extended/partial_cat.h
header.author: Paul Mensonides
header.overview: The header defines a concatenation macro that selectively allows each argument to expand on input.

macro.abstract: The macro is used as a partial operand to .
macro.para: By itself, the macro expands to nothing. It exists as a helper macro for .

macro.abstract: The macro is a concatenation macro that selectively allows each argument to expand before concatenation.

usage.param: The argument that determines whether a is allowed to expand. Valid values are 0 and 1.
The argument that determines whether __VA_ARGS__ is allowed to expand. Valid values are 0 and 1.
The left operand of the concatenation.
The right operand of the concatenation.

The argument that determines whether b is allowed to expand. Valid values are 0 and 1.

The right operand of the concatenation.

macro.para: This macro concatenates the rightmost preprocessing token of a to the leftmost preprocessing token of b or __VA_ARGS__.

If i is 1, a is allowed to expand prior to concatenation. Otherwise, it is not allowed to expand prior to concatenation. Likewise, if j is 1, b or __VA_ARGS__ is allowed to expand prior to concatenation. Otherwise, it is not allowed to expand prior to concatenation.
